conversation.text: Hello. I'm Sue. Would you like to make some Biscuit Bowls?
Yes, I want to make biscuit bowls with frozen dough.
Is your frozen dough already defrosted?
evidence: Open a 16.3 ounce (462 g) can of refrigerated bisc

conversation.text: Not yet, but you can teach me while it defrosts.
OK. To begin with we need to preheat the oven to 375F and prepare the muffin tin (or ramekins if you have them).
evidence: Set the temperature to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (177 degrees Celsius),

conversation.text: The oven is on. What now?
We are going to use the reverse side of a muffin tins as a mould. We need to grease it to make sure the dough can come off. Would you prefer to use butter or a cooking spray for this?
evidence: you can use a muffin tin and grease the backside of it.

conversation.text: Reverse side?
The underneath of it. The dough will be pressed onto it to make the bowl shape.
Thanks for clarification! What should I do then?
Before this we need to divide the dough into 8 pieces then roll them out into 5 inch circles. Do you have a rolling pin for this?
evidence: Separate the dough into individual biscuits.
Roll the dough pieces into circles.

conversation.text: Yes, I do.
Make sure you dust the rolling pin and bench with flour to stop the dough sticking to them.

conversation.text: Okay I am done with it.
Take one of the rolled out pieces of dough and place it on the muffin tin. Then gently mould it to the shape of the tin. Try not to make the sides too thin or they will burn.
evidence: Mold the dough around the ramekins.

conversation.text: No problem. Can I put it into the oven?
Have you moulded all the biscuit bowls?
Yes I have.
Great. Now we can put them in the oven and bake them. For your frozen dough it might take 16 to 18 minutes but I would watch them carefully and take them out if they seem ready sooner.

Excellent. Have a great day. Goodbye.

recipe.title: How to Make Biscuit Bowls from Refrigerated Dough

procedure.description: To ensure that the oven is hot enough when the biscuit bowls are ready, you must preheat the oven. Set the temperature to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (177 degrees Celsius), and let the oven heat fully.

procedure.summary: Invert several ramekins on a baking sheet and grease.
procedure.description: For the biscuit bowls, you’ll need 8 6-ounce (170 g) ramekins. Turn them over on a large baking sheet, and use nonstick cooking spray to grease the backs and sides of the ramekins. If you prefer, you can use butter to grease the ramekins. If you prefer, you can use a muffin tin and grease the backside of it.

procedure.summary: Separate the dough into individual biscuits.
procedure.description: Open a 16.3 ounce (462 g) can of refrigerated biscuit dough according to the package instructions. Use clean fingers to separate the dough into 8 individual biscuits. If the dough is sticking to your hands, dust them lightly with flour to make it easier to handle the biscuits.

procedure.summary: Roll the dough pieces into circles.
procedure.description: With the dough separated into 8 pieces, use a rolling pin to roll each one out on a lightly floured surface. Work each piece of dough into a 5-inch (13-cm) circle. It helps to lightly dust your rolling pin with flour before rolling out the dough.

procedure.summary: Mold the dough around the ramekins.
procedure.description: After you’ve rolled out the biscuit dough, lift each circle and place it on the back of one of the ramekins. Use your fingers to gently press the dough all around the ramekin to create a bowl shape. Be careful not to tear any holes in the dough as you shape it around the ramekins. If any occur, use your fingers to gently seal them closed so the bowl will remain in tact.

procedure.summary: Bake the biscuit bowls until golden.
procedure.description: After you’ve molded all of the biscuit dough onto the backs of the ramekins, place the cookie sheet that they’re on in the preheated oven. Allow the biscuits to bake for approximately 14 minutes, or until they are lightly browned. If you’re using frozen biscuit dough, make sure to allow it to thaw for at least 30 minutes at room temperature and bake them for 16 to 18 minutes.
